intro: Townsendia glabella, commonly known as the smooth Townsend's tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually smooth and narrowly lance-shaped, while its flowers are small and yellowish with a pale center. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral.
